Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Carotid Artery Stenting and Endarterectomy in Asymptomatic Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised to CAS or CEA, in addition to standard medical therapy

Participants.evidence: 2544 patients with ≥70% asymptomatic carotid stenosis, randomised to CAS or CEA

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare CAS and CEA outcomes in asymptomatic, non-octogenarian patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary composite endpoint was any stroke, myocardial infarction, or death during the periprocedural period or ipsilateral stroke within 4 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint showed no significant difference between CAS and CEA (5.3% vs. 5.1%, HR = 1.02; 95% CI 0.7–1.5; P=.91).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported as periprocedural complications.
